repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
This PR is alternative to #5753. I think this is superior because:
1. projects which uses not-setuptools build system will not have unneeded dependency
2. this is standard way how to manage dependencies which are optional - setuptools is needed only for building .c files.

Related to https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/5751

comment_data.body: This handling is repeating all the times and maybe it deserves to be moved to function. But not sure where this function put.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3,8 +3,17 @@
 import sys
 if sys.version_info < (3, 7):
     from .Distutils import build_ext
-del sys
 
+if sys.version_info > (3, 11):
+    try:
+        import setuptools
+    except ImportError:
+        raise ImportError(

comment_data.body: I was thinking that I would add only a note about setuptools dependency instead of putting it directly to example but I suppose this is what 99% of users will do. Also I intentionally not mentioned python3.12 (which is version of python when user needs to use setuptools), but I wanted to keep it simple and straightforward. Moreover it is better to start users teaching to use setuptools instead of distutils.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -44,7 +44,11 @@ according to the system used:
 
 The simplest way of installing Cython is by using ``pip``::
 
-  pip install Cython
+  pip install Cython[setuptools]

comment_data.body: I don't think this version check is correct.

@@ -3,8 +3,17 @@
 import sys
 if sys.version_info < (3, 7):
     from .Distutils import build_ext
-del sys
 
+if sys.version_info > (3, 11):

comment_data.body: It'll probably be removed at some point, and it's simple enough. I'm fine with repeating it.

comment_data.body: This is API. I don't think it should be removed.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -95,10 +99,6 @@ def __init__(self, name, sources,
         self.no_c_in_traceback = no_c_in_traceback
         self.cython_compile_time_env = cython_compile_time_env
 
-# class Extension
-
-read_setup_file = _Extension.read_setup_file
-

comment_data.body:
Problem is that in setuptools I was not able to find equivalent function.

Moreover, I was not able to find any mention of this function anywhere in Cython project...
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -95,10 +99,6 @@ def __init__(self, name, sources,
         self.no_c_in_traceback = no_c_in_traceback
         self.cython_compile_time_env = cython_compile_time_env
 
-# class Extension
-
-read_setup_file = _Extension.read_setup_file
-

comment_data.body: It is API for the users of the module, which is intended to be used as a drop-in replacement for `distutil.extension`, it is not (only) for Cython internal use. If `setuptools` does not define the same function, I would put the assignment right after the `distutils` imports and omit it in the `setuptools` case, hoping that no one actually uses it.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -95,10 +99,6 @@ def __init__(self, name, sources,
         self.no_c_in_traceback = no_c_in_traceback
         self.cython_compile_time_env = cython_compile_time_env
 
-# class Extension
-
-read_setup_file = _Extension.read_setup_file
-

@@ -95,10 +99,6 @@ def __init__(self, name, sources,
         self.no_c_in_traceback = no_c_in_traceback
         self.cython_compile_time_env = cython_compile_time_env

@@ -6,9 +6,18 @@
 import os
 import sys
 
-from distutils.errors import DistutilsArgError, DistutilsError, CCompilerError
-from distutils.extension import Extension
-from distutils.util import grok_environment_error
+try:
+    from distutils.errors import DistutilsArgError, DistutilsError, CCompilerError
+    from distutils.extension import Extension
+    from distutils.util import grok_environment_error
+except ImportError:
+    try:
+        from setuptools.errors import DistutilsArgError, DistutilsError, CCompilerError
+        from setuptools.extension import Extension
+        from setuptools._distutils.util import grok_environment_error

comment_data.body:
Without the qualifying module prefix, we'd better give this an explicit name (also for the import).
```suggestion
    def set_logging_threshold(level):
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -52,15 +52,36 @@
 import sys
 import time
 import copy
-import distutils.log
+
+try:
+    import distutils.log as logging
+    from distutils.log import set_threshold
+    from distutils.core import Distribution, Extension
+    from distutils.command.build_ext import build_ext
+    import distutils.errors as _setuptools_errors
+except ImportError:
+    import logging
+
+    def set_threshold(level):

comment_data.body: It seems worth moving these stray stdlib imports to the top while we're at it.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -52,15 +52,36 @@
 import sys
 import time
 import copy
-import distutils.log
+
+try:
+    import distutils.log as logging
+    from distutils.log import set_threshold
+    from distutils.core import Distribution, Extension
+    from distutils.command.build_ext import build_ext
+    import distutils.errors as _setuptools_errors
+except ImportError:
+    import logging
+
+    def set_threshold(level):
+        old_threshold = logging.root.getEffectiveLevel()
+        logging.root.setLevel(level)
+        return old_threshold
+
+    try:
+        from setuptools import Distribution, Extension
+        from setuptools.command.build_ext import build_ext
+        import setuptools.errors as _setuptools_errors
+    except ImportError:
+        raise ImportError(
+            "'distutils' cannot be imported. Please install setuptools."
+        )
+
 import textwrap
 
 IO_ENCODING = sys.getfilesystemencoding()
 IS_PY2 = sys.version_info[0] < 3
 
 import hashlib

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
   If cython is used only to generate .c files, the optional dependency on setuptools
   can be omitted (i.e. just ``pip install Cython``).
   This is useful mainly when an alternative build system like meson is used.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -44,7 +44,11 @@ according to the system used:
 
 The simplest way of installing Cython is by using ``pip``::
 
-  pip install Cython
+  pip install Cython[setuptools]
+
+.. Note::
+   When cython is used only to generate .c files, setuptools optional dependency can be omitted.
+   This is useful mainly when alternative build system like meson is used.

comment_data.body: We should probably get rid of that usage eventually. Not necessarily now.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6,9 +6,18 @@
 import os
 import sys
 
-from distutils.errors import DistutilsArgError, DistutilsError, CCompilerError
-from distutils.extension import Extension
-from distutils.util import grok_environment_error
+try:
+    from distutils.errors import DistutilsArgError, DistutilsError, CCompilerError
+    from distutils.extension import Extension
+    from distutils.util import grok_environment_error
+except ImportError:
+    try:
+        from setuptools.errors import DistutilsArgError, DistutilsError, CCompilerError
+        from setuptools.extension import Extension
+        from setuptools._distutils.util import grok_environment_error

commit.message: Wrap all distutils imports instead of checking setuptools at package level
Revert sysconfig import, it is migrated in separate PR
